tasks.task: Planting onions from seeds in containers
subtasks: Gather materials (containers, potting soil, onion seeds)
Mix peat moss and potting soil for better drainage
Sprinkle granular bone meal (for root growth) into soil
Soak onion seeds in water to loosen them for separation (not mentioned but implied)
Gently separate onion roots without damaging them
Plant onions at proper depth (not too deep), ensuring roots are covered
Consider thinning out onions later for better spacing
Prepare for mulching with dried leaves (not done in the video but planned)

tasks.task: Using a garden kneeler for planting comfort
subtasks: Sit on the kneeler to reduce back and knee strain while planting
Use the kneeler in various gardening activities (both indoor and outdoor)
Identify and remove smaller onions for immediate use
Thin onions to the desired final spacing, considering their mature size
Collect and store dried leaves as a future mulch material
Plan to apply mulch when onions have established themselves

tasks.task: using a garden kneeler to sit while planting. So, I can write MAINTASK: Using a garden kneeler for planting comfort. Then the subtasks would be sitting on the kneeler to reduce strain on back and knees, and using it for various gardening activities.
Planting onions in containers. Subtasks: gathering materials, mixing potting soil, adding fertilizer, and watering.

MAINTASK: Thinning onions. Subtasks: identifying smaller onions, removing them. They also mention mulching with dried leaves, which might be another task: preparing for mulching.
